data: BCC Venous Thromboembolism (VTE) Prophylaxis (Module)
Medications
STEP 1:  Is VTE Prophylaxis NOT indicated?
No VTE prophylaxis or additional VTE therapy required. Reassess if length of stay is extended beyond 24 hours
VTE Prophylaxis Contraindication
Expected length of stay less than 24 hours
Already receiving anticoagulation therapy
STEP 2: Is pharmacological prophylaxis contraindicated?
Reassess daily to start pharmacologic prophylaxis if contraindication resolves
VTE Prophylaxis Contraindication
Contraindication, High risk of serious bleeding into a critical site (intracranial, intraspinal, pericardial, intraocular, retroperitoneal, intra-articular)
Contraindication, Active bleeding of clinical significance
Contraindication, Uncontrolled systolic hypertension of 180 mmHg or higher
Contraindication, Platelet count less than 50 x 10 9/L
Contraindication, Known major bleeding disorder or acquired coagulopathy (such as due to acute liver failure)
Contraindication, Lumbar puncture/epidural/spinal anesthesia expected within next 12 hours
Contraindication, Lumbar puncture/epidural/spinal anesthesia received in previous 4 hours
Contraindication, History of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (consider hematology consult)
Contraindication, History of hypersensitivity to low-molecular weight heparin or unfractionated heparin (consider hematology consult)
Contraindication
STEP 3: Provide VTE prophylaxis for patients who do not meet criteria in Step 1 or 2
Dalteparin SmartSample Card can be obtained from VCC Pharmacy to provide patients upon discharge with 10 free prefilled dalteparin prophylactic syringes from the Community Pharmacy
